content.content: twitter.com    TRON DAO Reserve @trondaoreserve  🤩 Introducing our new Peg Stability Module (PSM)!  🤑 Users can now exchange #USDT for #USDD at a fixed rate of 1:1 with 0 slippage!  Together we #BUIDL the best #StableCoin $USDD!  🔗 tdr.org/#/psm https://t.co/NdqTFqMKMH   1:25 PM - 3 Aug 2022           220                57            Once again Justin Sun and his gang emulate an original MakerDAO creation, this is without a doubt incredible, but it clearly marks the trends that MakerDAO generates. The Apple of the DeFi industry? possibly.
They didnt even change the product name! But sketch that they are using USDT…

Quite funny. The purpose of this kind of PSM (until it is loaded with significant funding, at least) is to protect against a depeg to the upside, which is a problem DAI has certainly had. Have a hard time envisioning the UST ponzi clone having this issue…
It’s pretty funny if you think about it, not even the name was changed. In practical terms the PSM works, they always copy the king.

Maybe I’m misunderstanding how USDD works. Assuming it works exactly like UST, then you want the peg to float high so people buy up the speculative token to redeem it for USDD to realize the arbitrage and close the spread back to peg. The goal here is to pump up the price of the speculative token… so why would they add an alternative mechanism for arbitraging the peg? Are they betting they can rug more from the USDT balance in the PSM than they can gain from the liquidity available for dumping the overpriced speculative token (Tron?)?

With this function I don’t really know what they are betting on, they devise it as it was in the UST scenario was pemirit to lose that peg to the upside to keep burning LUNA. I really don’t understand why they add this, because it gives parity and I don’t see any intention to keep burning TRX for it.  The USDD TEAM

Its funny that in USDD creation they attempt to differentiate themselves as being super decentralized and saying how they will be different than USDC and USDT but here they are pairing with USDT…  Screenshot_20220810-143836_Medium972×2288 352 KB
some time ago, they created a USDJ coin similar to MakerDAO’s CDP, all completely the same as Maker’s vaults, they always try to imitate everything hahaha.

Do you know anything about the team behind the stablecoin [USK] (Former Terra-Affiliated Project Kujira to Issue Stablecoin) called Kujira. Seems like another DAI copy cat but its focus is in the Cosmos blockchain. A couple if interesting takeways from their explained tokenimics:  Soft-pegged to USD and will not allow USDC as collateral Vaults will have a borrow rate (i.e. stability fee) and a mint fee that will be used to burn their governance token. Potentially a good idea for us Cosmos blockchain selected for their project, potentially due to the lack of a native stablecoin on the chain, low fees and relatively easy to develop on  Would love to hear your thoughts and if you think this stablecoin will have any traction
The more stablecoins the better. Using Maker apparatus moves them to the conservative side, that can’t be a bad thing.
Opinion: stablecoin success is about creating economy and providing monied-utility. Maker does that.
